paragraphOne.textOne: Front-end Programmer and Designer specialist in creating technological solutions with Web standards
paragraphOne.textTwo: I study English, Spanish and speak brazilian portuguese

paragraphTwo.textOne: Always developing solutions with technologies: CSS, HTML, JavaScript
paragraphTwo.textTwo: React.js and the Framework's Angular, Vue.js, and Svelte.js
paragraphTwo.textThree: Webpack, Gulp.js, Grunt.js, ParcelJS, Cypress.io, Quasar.js, Nuxt.js, Typescript, ES6
paragraphTwo.textFour: Working with unit tests in Vitest, Jest and Karma

paragraphThree.textOne: I use Git as code versioner and Github, Bitbucket, Gitlab
paragraphThree.textTwo: The Stylus.js preprocessor for working with CSS, I also work with Less and Sass
paragraphThree.textThree: Always looking to develop and write semantic HTML with the latest version
paragraphThree.textFour: Using maximum that language offers, I also use Pug.js a template engine

paragraphFour.textOne: My focus is improving information with performance, a lot of quality, and innovation
paragraphFour.textTwo: Creating End-to-End tests with Cypress.io, generating positive results in projects
paragraphFour.textThree: Doing research and usability tests, improving the experience with CSS animations

senac.description:
I developed a portfolio using CSS, HTML, JavaScript, PHP and MySQL
I learned concepts and use of the Adobe package tools
Helped classmates to better understand the subject and encouraged them to evolve, seeking to consolidate and share all learning and knowledge with practical examples and functional
During the course I developed my personal page applying the knowledge I learned there, in addition to already practicing and applying the knowledge in the internship I was doing at the same time at the Intima Store
